prompt.p: The composition of intracellular and extracellular fluids differs in order to maintain an osmotic gradient: oncotic pressure, which facilitates movement of fluid between compartments.
What is the extracellular concentration of sodium?

modalFeedback.p:
Option A (145 mM) is Correct. Extracellular Na + concentration is about 145 mM, but may vary between laboratories.
Option B (116 mM) is Incorrect. Extracellular Na + concentration is about 145 mM.
Option C (139 mM) is Incorrect. Extracellular Na + concentration is about 145 mM.
Option D (1.8 mM) is Incorrect. Extracellular Na + concentration is about 145mnM.
Option E (12 mM) is Incorrect. Extracellular Na + concentration is about 145 mM.
